Reviews.Title: “Great Roma, recently redecorated”
Reviews.Author: LauraSayerG
Reviews.Content: Amazing, heavy hallway doors block any noise. Entire hotel has been recently redecorated, very pleasant. Granite counters in the bathrooms. Breakfast included was below average, butbtehvalue overall was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Enthusiast_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple days during last week of December. Good rate for the area, well furnished and comfortable room. Reserved an "executive" room on an upper floor. On check-in the clerk said he was upgrading me to an executive room, as if I had already not reserved it. Oh well, if he wanted extra credit for being good to me, no harm - no foul. The kicker was that both nights, the upper executive floor was occupied by a couple of families with noisy, misbehaving young children allowed to hang out in the hallway. I would expect that an advertised "executive" floor would not be where they put young families, especially when the hotel had a high vacancy rate during these days. My other issue was the very loud traffic noise from the adjacent freeway all night long. If I owned this hotel, I would be putting in better noise-abatement windows.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest friendliest staff and very comfortable spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: DontSettleLA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and was very happy. I made the best decision not to go to the Marriott Warner Center because the Marriott charges for everything.. like Internet and Parking which can add up. This Holiday Inn property provides free Internet and Parking and is only three minutes from the Warner Center. It has a Trader Joes right next door for great food values as well as a Whole Foods a few minutes walk down the block. The best part is that the staff is the friendliest and they make you feel very welcomed and appreciated. I also found the rooms to be spacious and the bed very comfortable. No need to pay for overpriced hotel rooms elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed and pillows!”
Reviews.Author: bigdogishere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business trip for two nights and was very pleased with location,room,etc. Staff was very helpful and accommodating during my stay. Breakfast was very good with the buffet. Bed and pillows some of the best ever slepted on in my travels and room very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RavenGirl18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while a family member was having surgery at the nearby Kaiser Permanente hospital and it was very convenient. The hotel offers a discounted rate for family of Kaiser patients and also has a shuttle to and from the hospital, if needed. The walk is 15-20 minutes. The room was quiet, comfortable and genuinely smoke free. There is a Trader Joe's next door. The staff were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: maehlum
Reviews.Content: Good location for business in this area, easy to find and close to the freeway. The last fact implies that there may be some noise. There is a good selection of businesses around. My room was fine although there were not much leftover space with two beds in the room. There was no worktable in the room. It had a fridge but you have to fill it up yourselves. All in all it offer good value for the money. This was my second stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly adequate for most travel needs. It is pretty basic, has a decent pool, and is in a good neighborhood. It does not have a resort feel, so I wouldnt go here as a destination, but it served our needs perfectly as a place to crash while touring colleges and universities in the LA area with my daughter. There's a Trader Joe's right next door, so getting food is very convenient. Wireless internet is free, and Priority club members get free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ! very clean, very good service, and afordable”
Reviews.Author: MimoVoyage
Reviews.Content: Nic and Mel The best bed ever sleeted in on vacation, rooms are big and bright. Service is impeccable. The rooms and the hotel are very clean and very well maintained. The breakfast is really good. For the price I was pleasantly surprise. I recommend strongly this hotel. The succes of this hotel is realy the staff super

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Holiday Inn Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: first100countries
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a weekend visit to Los Angeles and we stayed at the Holiday Inn Woodland Hills for three nights (June 24-26). I found the hotel a bit dated but very clean. The beds were extremely comfy. I couldn't emphasize this enough. The bathroom towels even smelled wonderful. This is not a luxury hotel and if you are after flat screen tv's and top of the line furnishings, this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for a place to sleep in after a day full of actvities in LA and in search of value for your buck, I recommend this hotel. I wouldn't hesitate returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old, broken hotel with friendly front-desk staff”
Reviews.Author: element14
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, everyone that I dealt wth at the front desk is great. Now the negatives: 1) "Gym" is a joke. Gear must be 15 years old--upright bike, no-name stairmaster, and two treadmills (one broken). I spoke to Ryan Block (GM) on my first visit and he assured me that the treadmill would be fixed when I returned the following week It wasn't. He didn't call to let me know and he didn't return my call (I have his business card with what is supposed to be a direct number on it) when I tried to find out the status. Since nobody uses upright bikes or stairmasters (some people might never have seen the latter if too young), working out at this hotel might be impossible, especially since the "gym" closes at 1100P -- it was for me on two separate times with people already waiting for someone to get off the treadmill. 2) I had a signficant load of dry cleaning and laundry -- about $50. Suit, jeans, dress shirts, casual shirts and a few tee-shirts. A tee shirrt was not returned to me and I inquired about it a number of times without anyone ever calling me back or finding out. Called Ryan, but he didn't return my call. It was only a Banana Republic tee so I gave up on the $25 or so item and guess I'll just have to pay to replace it myself. Fortunaltely they didn't lose my Armani suit. Other than losing an article of mine, the dry cleaning was probably a bit better than average. But it seems you have to sacrifice a piece of clothing (I couldn't find the offical rules on how this works) from time to time so you be the judge of whether it's worth it. 3) They have no store onsite which is fine and they do have a soda/snack vending machine. I tried to break a $20 at the front desk a little after midnight and the front desk clerk only had 3 one-dollar bills. IT was a little frustrating because I had a $10 and was at the hotel there for three nights and wanted to tip $15 ($5/night) and couldn't leave more than $10 as a result. I also couldn't ahve the bag of Cheesy Poofs I had my eye on. This lack of attention is a little odd because of one factor. I'm currently leading an engagement where one of the sales people signed a lousy T&E reimbursement policy so my team has to suck it up and stay in a less expensive alternative than say a Marriott or Hilton. I picked this hotel primarily because of location -- less than a mile to the client means that I can walk there and back. I indicated to Ryan that I was going to be in town three or four nights per week for 10-14 weeks, depending on how the engagement develops. As I indicated, he promised to fix the treadmill the first week -- I told him in no uncertain terms that I could not stay in a hotel where I cannot work out. I also indicated that the 40+ nights I would be there should generate enough revenue to not only fix the treadmill, but buy something like, say an elliptical trainer. And maybe some dumbbells. 4) TVs are not flat screens. Not that I watch a lot of TV, but if I do, I think that a hotel can spring $500 for 37" flat screen for each room. Anyway, I've gone on long enough. Nothing special about this hotel (could use a remodel) and many problems. Nice staff can't come close to making up for deficiencies. I think that owners/management are just greedy and trying to make as much money while spending as little as possible. Some people never learn that soemtimes you have to spend money to make money -- I'll never return losing them about 40 nights of guaranteed business and some my team as I staff up this engagement. If you like Holiday Inns, I've heard that the Holiday Inn Express (apparently different owners) a couple of miles down Ventura Blvd. is nice enought, very new and about the same price. As they say -- you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay....”
Reviews.Author: blueroses_13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions. I like that there are many dining options very close to the hotel and having Trader Joe's across the street is nice as well. My disappointment stems from trying the fitness room on this visit. What I found were two treadmills--one out of order and one that kept jumping from 4mph to 6mph--a stair climber and a bicycle. The bicycle didn't have any power so it couldn't be set up to run a program. It looked old. Given the neighborhood I would think the facilities would be much more modern. Other than that my stay has been nice so far. The front desk people were quick and I was checked into my room in no time. The room itself was clean and well prepared--I even had two free bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: JoannaSD
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and tired from sitting in traffic. The staff was completely on point. They could spot the tired mom with three kids coming. They got us in the door and to our room quickly. The room was comfortable and quiet. The cafe staff in the morning was dialed in to my children's little idiocincracies with breakfast choices, and they both had a terrific sense of humor. The food was terrific and they went over the top making sure we were prepared for our day. I'd absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: VegasWest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this HI on business for one night during the week. It was very busy and the parking lot was full. I was done with my meetings a little early and was able to get a nice king room at 1pm. The front desk staff was average, but when I needed to find the business center, a gentlemen from the front desk walked me to it since it was kind of by the lounge. The room itself was large, and very clean. It looks like the room was recently renovated with nice blue curtains and linens. The bathroom was nice also and was clean. I did not hear anyone else in the hotel during my stay. Also decent areas to eat around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & Very Ordinary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: z1bby
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Country Inn in Calabasas, but decided to try HI on Ventura. Wrong decision really. When we checked in, I dont think the guy on the desk even bothered to speak to us, other than to tell us the room number. Totally disinterested in his role. Ordinary all round, though HI always have really comfy beds, but the pillows only get 3 stars at this hotel. It was quite noisy too, and I was aware that it's situated right alongside the 101, but you could hear the continuious hum from the freeway. We got caught up with spring break too and had a very disruptive Saturday night with a group of kids arriving on our floor around 11.30pm with a lot of door slamming and yelling and general boistriousness until I poked my head out the door and told them to be quiet. They all headed out only to return at 4am - more door slamming and yelling. A call to the front desk sent secruity up to sort them out, but the comment from the front desk in the morning was that they have no control over those sorts of situations. I was speachless - they run the hotel for goodness sake, they can decide who stays and who gets chucked out if they're not behaving themselves! Oh, and housekeeping liked to knock on the door around 8am in the mornings - a little early for guests who are staying more than one night, surely there are check out rooms that can be done at this time of the morning. Needless to say, it;'s back to Country Inn & Suites in Calabasas for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, extremely clean and very disabled-friendly”
Reviews.Author: LAKen2
Reviews.Content: I visited my disabled mother this weekend and stayed with her at this Holiday Inn. Front desk person Nancy offered to assist me with my mother's wheelchair if I had difficulty getting it out of the car trunk as I had mentioned that I had injured my back. I was really surprised that she would offer to do this (it's certainly beyond the call of duty) and no, I didn't take her up on the offer but it really was a nice way to begin our stay at the hotel. The accessible room had a bathroom that was roomy and easy to wheel around in. The entire room was very clean, in fact, I've stayed in many hotels and this was the cleanest room that I have ever experienced. What a refreshing change from the Hilton Woodland Hills stay last weekend! When my mother stated that she'd like to play cards, I told her that I didn't have any but would ask the front desk if I could buy some somewhere. A gentleman told me that he'd search for a deck of cards and let me know if he could find any. Minutes later, there was a knock at my door and a staff person was standing there with a new deck of cards for us. Truly amazing. I didn't try the restaurant but they have a satisfaction-guarantee and due to the above customer service, I have no doubt that they would honor it. I will be returning to this hotel soon, I thought that customer service like this had vanished many years ago but am happy to report that it still can be found at the Holiday Inn- Woodland Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly / efficient staff and very clean room”
Reviews.Author: joyboyMonterey
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend getaway with the kids. Great pool area, good size rooms which where very clean and comfortable. Convenient location and great value. The staff had great knowledge of the surrounding area. All employees we encountered were professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - over quality room”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my wife in vacations, visiting friends at the area and the Universal Studios theme park. I booked a non-smoking king room at executive level, at a reasonable rate. Rate didn't include breakfast. But room has free internet (wireless) and free parking (almost full both nights). Room was surprisingly big. Extremely clean and fresh. Bed very comfortable, and a menu to select different types of pillows. My wife actually selected a different one that was provided in just a few minutes. Room had a small fridge. Bathroom amenities were mint scented, really a good surprise. Only negative aspect would be the internet connection: slow.

Reviews.Title: “Much Nicer than the pictures! Wish it was closer to the 405”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hey Everyone, I usually stay in Sherman Oaks Best Western but they actually wanted 170/night at that property which is nice but not THAT nice...Maybe they are trying to loose the questionable element north of Burbank but they also priced out my business.. Sooo I just stayed at the this hotel and I was VERY PLESANTLY SURPRISED..First of all the room look edmuch more modern then the photos above..The bedding is a crisp clean white duvet, not the usual horrid floral. I stayed in an executive room which was nice and large on a higher floor (worth the extra ten bucks but the fridge is small). Great soaps and water pressure and also they made a robe avaliable. Good Pay per view movies avail( including indies).Solid Internet Service unlike the Comfort Inn down the street Funnily water bottles have seemed an issue in other reviews but when I checked in they offered me a FREE ICE COLD WATER right away since it was hot out.. to clear up this issue mentioned the previous bad reviews..Rooms come with 2 Holiday Inn Water Bottles (you can always get more for free at the front desk) and they also have 2 FIJI Bottles which are 3.00 dollars each which is says in the bottles! So I hope that puts the issue to rest... Critques: I had to change rooms on the second day because the pay movies were not working on my tv the night before and I didn't want a room switch at 11pm, The Fridge is a half mini-fridge which is small...Encino is close but not that close once you drive down Ventura a couple times in bad traffic...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumosumo
Reviews.Content: Good Clean hotel. Has a small restaraunt/lounge onsite. Breakfast kind of pricey. Floors insulated real well, you can't hear the people above you walking. Close to freeway. Staff not so friendly, kind of just blank stares on their faces. Good location and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: cobwabo
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and rate of 99$ good online. Unfortunately, the hotel has seen better times and all is kind of shabby, not chic. The water in the room was not complimentary as I assumed based on the reviews and the receptionist at check-out was being VERY rude about it. All in all, the place is substandard for a Holiday Inn and I will not bring my family back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great little stay”
Reviews.Author: gwen7g
Reviews.Content: This stop was a drive through night for us from LA to Santa Barbara. That being said, we didn't do really anything around the area aside from dinner at PF Changs. The service was excellent. We had the best room I think, so it was of course awesome. Suite with two tvs and a jacuzzi. But the bed- was AMAZINGLY comfortable. We stayed in a different place every night for 7 nights, and this hotel's bed was the best :) I think I read some post that said the bed was not good. Maybe ours was replaced, because it was divine. We did sit by the pool for an hour before we hit the road, it's totally next to the freeway which is funny, but doesn't seem like the sort of place people expect to lounge by the pool. The pool itself was nice and fine though. For that area, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LadynNC
Reviews.Content: For the price $99 Fri, Sat, Sun & $169 for weekday, I found this to be an excellent value. The rooms were clean, and very well appointed. The staff was friendly and VERY accommodating, when I asked to check in at 10:30 am and the normal check in time is 3:00. They had a room cleaned and ready for me in about 30 minutes. The restaurant's food was excellent, however room service charges I found a bit high with and 18% gratuity charge, $2 delivery charge, 9.25% tax, and you still needed to tip the bellhop (this may be standard for CA). So a $10 breakfast ended up being $20. Oh well the food was great and worth the room service charges if you are like me and like to enjoy spending your morning in your robe. I highly recommend the California Omelet ! I was in and out during the day and evening and the parking is well lit and I felt safe coming and going. I did not make use of the pool or other facilities, however notice they appeared well kept and clean. P.S. I really liked the Mint Shampoo and Conditioner!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Woodland Hills-Warner Center. Nostalgic, average, and older exterior with pleasantly upgraded interior common areas and rooms. Comfortable lobby with couches and chairs-limited service restaurant. The "lounge" is actually a 6 foot wide bar with two bar stools- the kind you'd find in someone's basement! Drinks limited to beer and wine- we found it quite charming. Hospitable and helpful staff. Pleasant rooms, upgraded linens, clean bathroom, acceptable mattress. Inviting outdoor pool area. Hotel location is superb- close to the freeway, 23 miles to Malibu, and within a block or two of many pubs and restaurants. We had a light meal at Poquito Mas, and then went on a pub walk-all within 3 blocks of the hotel. Lively British Pub across the street, as well as a nice sized grocery/liquor store. Truly, you won't go wrong here. (Our credit card was compromised during our weekend in Woodland Hills-can't say for sure where-but we had a memorable trip.) Overall- a nice hotel at a nice price. Hotel exceeded our moderate expectations

Reviews.Title: “Not phenomenal, not awful.”
Reviews.Author: gregpbc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older building that has been updated and renovated within the last few years. The outside is pretty rough, but the inside is clean and respectable. The beds were not very comfortable. It's too bad that they didn't upgrade them when they renovated. They don't even compare to the beds in most of the Holiday Inn Expresses. The bright spot in this hotel was the staff. They were very pleasant, friendly, and attentive to your every need. If you are looking for a clean, friendly hotel with average amenities, this would be a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: NavTrav
Reviews.Content: Good location for northwest side of LA. Many restaurants/bars within walking distance. Whole Foods as well. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Room- clean, well appointed. Free WiFi. Two bottles of water free in room. Gym- below average. Woud stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Madigan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Holiday Inn in Woodland Hills and feel compelled to write a review. We were here for a few days visiting family in the area. We had two rooms that were clean and comfortable. Small bathrooms would be the only drawback. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were a decent size. The staff at this hotel were exceptional. Friendly, professional and courteous. The hotel was clean, the pool was clean and the grounds were kept really nice. I had misgivings about coming here at first but would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a place that had a restaurant, pool and a good location this is it. It is in a busy location and right off the 101 Freeway but then again we didn't find much in that area that wasn't. I really recommend this hotel. The staff couldn't be nicer and the hotel was really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Keatho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel twice in the past six weeks. The first time we stayed there we had a regular room that overlooked the swimming pool. It was great. You could see the pool but you couldn't hear the people in the pool. We ordered room service and it came very quickly and was delicious. The room had excellent air conditioning and the bed was very comfortable. We just came back from our second trip to Woodland Hills and this time we stayed in a suite. The room had so much space in it and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub with sliding louvered windows that could open or close for privace. The shower was in a separate glassed in area and the water pressure was excellent. We had a 32 inch TV, a chair and a small couch in the room as well. My wife likes to sleep with a fan blowing on her and requested onr from the front desk. It was no problem, they said, and we soon had a fan in our room. Robes were provided for us as well. And of course, a coffee maker was provided, along with an iron and an ironing board. The staff couldn't have been nicer to us. Room service, again, was swift and delightful, and the food was excellent. All in all, both trips were excellent. The rooms are so nice and clean and the staff is the most friendly and courteous I have ever met. We will definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Shop Around!”
Reviews.Author: Trube
Reviews.Content: We were a little uncomfortable with the area. The hotel itself was old, did not look like it had been kept up over the years, the room was small and they did not offer a complimentary breakfast. Some relatives of ours found a nicer, cleaner hotel in a better neighborhood in Woodland Hills for the same price. I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcbgator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past six months and plan to stay there again next week. When I first stayed there, I was pleasantly surprised by the decore and amenities in the "Executive" room. The bathrobe is a nice touch. The bed is comfortable and the shower head is great. Also, two bottles of water are provided each day. I have actually opted to stay at this hotel over the Hilton Garden Inn in Calabasas, because of the amenties and the lower cost. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this hotel. Towels were huge and luxurious! The bathroom looked brand new and was very nice with a tall shower head. Bad part was that there was no spa and the pool closed early. Also, the beds were not very comfortable...we could practically feel the springs under our backs, but still the overall experience was great. The carpet was clean and the furniture was nice enough I would actually want to touch it, unlike many other hotels! We got the family suite and had 2 adjoining rooms, and both were nice. Enjoy your stay here!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Woodland Hills-Warner Center
HotelInfo.Address: 21101 Ventura Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 91364
